== My knowledge level ==

I am a proven C/C++ developer, with experience in configuration management systems (CVS, Subversion, Continuus).
I am a script kiddy, used to Bash and Makefiles, more recently using Ruby (on Rails) and interested in Python.
I am an expert in Linux systems and network administration. I am also an advanced Windows user.

== Where I have Ubuntu running: ==

* our <nowiki>[[http://lucidia.net|server]]</nowiki> (Ubuntu Server Feisty Fawn, running 24/7)
* my desktop (Kubuntu Feisty Fawn)
* my media center (Kubuntu Feisty Fawn)
* my wife's laptop (Kubuntu Edgy Eft)

== My participation ==

I have written a few pages, such as <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuWirelessRouter|UbuntuWirelessRouter]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BridgingNetworkInterfaces|BridgingNetworkInterfaces]]</nowiki>.

I try to help with bugs.

I would like to write an application to make it dead easy to do what my pages (above) describe.

I am also developping my own backup program, <nowiki>[[http://code.google.com/p/hbackup/|hbackup]]</nowiki>, and online photo album manager, <nowiki>[[http://code.google.com/p/halbum/|halbum]]</nowiki>, as if there were not enough lying around ;-)

Finally, I developped some scripts to help with cross-compilation mixed with native compilation, called <nowiki>[[http://code.google.com/p/makeptf/|makeptf]]</nowiki> (PTF stands for two things: Package Tayloring Format and I leave you to guess the other).

== My quick advices ==

* use nfs-kernel-server rather then nfs-user-server
* use libjasper-runtime for Kopete to support webcam calls
* use Mozilla plugins (including flash) for Konqueror too
* when lost, try the unofficial guide: http://ubuntuguide.org/
